field.name: summary
field.value: New instance request: backend application server

field.name: description
field.value: We need a new instance for deploying a backend for Job Spider. It will be responsible for performing address geocoding and job posting scraping. None of these tasks requires storing data on disk, so the new instance does not have to have a lot of disk capacity. It has to run many processes in parallel though, so instance needs at least 2 CPUs. We reviewed EC2 instance types with their pricing and think that 'c3.large' instance with 3.75 GiB of memory and 2 virtual CPUs will be a good fit.

comment.author: dru
comment.text: What are the software requirements for Job Spider? I.e. what applications do you need installed/configured to support the application on the new instance?

comment.author: rob
comment.text: It's going to run basically the same thing the existing instance runs, but just with a subset of the classes: Play and Akka.

comment.author: andrey.chorniy
comment.text: We'll need to be able to install latest version of java 7 and playframework 2.2.0, plus midnight-commander. Please open port 8765 on this and insidehire.com server, so they can communicate with each-other. This server should be able to access Mongo and ES servers (not sure if we need anything for that) Generally it would be good to have sudo access during deployment since we may need to install something else

comment.author: dru
comment.text: Andrey/Nikolay, you should be able to ssh to js1.insidehire.com=54.235.214.110 (i-d6cb9039). Please run the Job Spider scraper as user 'jobspider'. You've been granted full sudo privileges to this user. The root(/) partition is an EBS volume and will retain data across reboots. Space is limited here but you indicated no writing to disk so this should not be a problem. If you require temporary storage of large files or data, please use /s3data. This is an ephemeral partition backed by S3 that will be destroyed on reboot. I have installed openjdk-7-jdk per your requirements. Please let me know when the application is functioning as desired so I can convert this instance into an AMI for future deployments.
